The rods are made out of tungsten.
And there are two reasons for this.
The first is that tungsten is really, really dense.
A cubic meter of tungsten weighs 19 tons.
That's over twice the density of steel
which is what we're using here
just because it's a lot cheaper.
But that means for a given amount of mass
tungsten rods could be less than half the volume of steel
and therefore encounter less resistance
as they pass through the atmosphere.

tungsten also has an incredibly high melting point.
The highest of any metal,
at almost three and a half thousand degrees celsius.

a lot of heat builds up all around it.
